intro: Castilleja latebracteata, commonly known as the late bract castilleja, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow to orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Its leaves are reduced, and it relies on other plants for some of its nutrients. Castilleja latebracteata is often found in association with lodgepole pine and other coniferous trees.
